articles.title: 60th Birthday of WPK Observed in Different Countries
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Highly Praised
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung's Exploits Highly Praised 
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- President Kim Il Sung rendered unstinted support and aid, both material and moral, to the African people in their struggle for liberation and independence and the building of a new society. This was one more expression of great political support to the cause of the African people.
 Alpha Oumar Konare, chairman of the Committee of the African Union, said this when receiving credentials from the DPRK permanent representative at the AU on Oct. 20.    
 Recalling that he had the honor of being received by  Kim Il Sung when he was visiting the DPRK as Malian president in December, 1992, he noted that this was of great significance in his political career and he would always remember that day.
 Hoping that leader Kim Jong Il would lead the Korean people to steady victory and prosperity by successfully carrying forward the cause of Kim Il Sung, he expressed the belief that the DPRK government and people would continue to boost the historic, traditional and excellent relations of friendship and cooperation with the African people.

articles.title: Reception Given on "Day of UN"
articles.content:
Reception Given on "Day of UN" 
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- Timo Pakkala, UN resident coordinator and resident representative of the UNDP, and representatives of the international organizations here hosted a reception on Monday evening on the occasion of the "Day of the UN".
 Present there on invitation were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Choe Su Hon and officials concerned and diplomatic envoys of different countries here. 
 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.title: Probe into Missing Nuclear Substance Urged in S. Korea
articles.content:
Probe into Missing Nuclear Substance Urged in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- The South Headquarters of the National Alliance of Youth and Students for the Country's Reunification reportedly issued a statement on Oct. 21 to urge a probe into the truth behind missing nuclear weapon substance. 
 Referring to the disclosed fact that the U.S. exported hundreds of tons of nuclear substance to south Korea, the statement said that the fact proves the U.S. shameless action of committing the illegal export of basic raw materials of nuclear weapons, finding fault with the nuclear issue of someone.
 The U.S. considers it natural to possess nuclear weapons or nuclear substance, while being dead set against the nuclear issue of other countries, the statement noted, stressing that the U.S. is producing nuclear weapons for itself and forcing the north to remove nuclear weapons. This shameless demand should be rectified, the statement said, adding:    
 The U.S. should probe the truth behind nuclear weapon substance in a sincere and honest manner.

articles.title: Prosecution Authorities Condemned for Anachronistic Act in S. Korea
articles.content:
Prosecution Authorities Condemned for Anachronistic Act in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- The Democratic Workers' Party of south Korea reportedly held a press conference in front of the building of the Supreme Public Prosecutor's Office on Oct. 20 to denounce the prosecution authorities for their anachronistic act of taking issue with the academic activity and conscientious assertion of Prof. Kang Jong Gu in league with conservative forces including the Grand National Party and talking about "defence of the system" and "save-the-nation movement" in a bid to keep the moribund "National Security Law."
 Speakers at the press conference stressed that "the prosecution authorities should honestly confess to the people and repent of their crime of taking the lead in suppressing numerous democratic figures while flattering on the power and being reduced to a maid of the government.    
 A press release held that the Public Prosecutor's Office, a conservative group, should come to its sense, dismantle its public security department and liquidate scandal prosecution, public security prosecution and political prosecution.

Anniversary of Famous Work of Kim Jong Il Observed
Withdrawal of U.S. Troops from South Korea Urged
Anniversary of CPV's Entry into Korean Front Observed
Minju Joson on Japan's Bid for Permanent Seat of UN Security Council
Greetings to Austrian Federal President
articles.content:
Greetings to Austrian Federal President
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Heinz Fischer, federal president of Austria, on October 20 on the occasion of its 50th national day. 
 Expressing the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the interests of the two peoples, the message wished him great success in his responsible work for prosperity of the country and welfare of the people.

articles.title: Greetings to Austrian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Austrian Foreign Minister
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) - Paek Nam Sun, minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Ursula Plassnik, federal minister of Foreign Affairs of Austria, on the occasion of its 50th national day.
 Expressing the belief that the relations between the two countries would boost in the idea of independence, peace and friendship, the message wished him greater success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Pujon Potato Starch Factory Built
articles.content:
Pujon Potato Starch Factory Built
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- The Pujon Potato Starch Factory situated in the township of Pujon County, South Hamgyong Province, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea, was commissioned on the occasion of the 60th birthday of the Workers' Party of Korea.
 It, with a total floor space of over 3,000 square meters, covers more than 20,000 square meters. It has a capacity to produce thousands of tons of potato starch a year. 
 All the production processes ranging from weighing, measuring dirt and starch content of potatoes, pulverizing, processing and heating to packing are operated on an assembly-line.    
 The starch produced by the factory is snow-white and of good quality and its by-products are available for feed of domestic animals and fertilizer.
 The factory will contribute to industrializing the potato processing and improving the dietary life of the people in the northern highland of Korea.

articles.title: President of IFRCRCS and His Party Wind up Korea Visit
articles.content:
President of IFRCRCS and His Party Wind up Korea Visit
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- Juan Manuel Suarez del Toro, president of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, and his party left here today after winding up its four-day visit to the DPRK.
 They were seen off at the airport by Paek Yong Ho, vice-chairman of the Central Committee of the DPRK Red Cross Society, and the head of the aid delegation of the IFRCRCS.    
 During their stay they visited Mangyongdae and objects of aid in Anju City, South Phyongan Province.

articles.title: Wreaths Laid before Friendship Tower
Chinese Embassy Lays Wreath before Friendship Tower
South Korean Delegation and German Quintet Here
articles.content:
South Korean Delegation and German Quintet Here
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the south Korean "Yun I Sang Peace Fund" headed by Director Sin Kye Ryun who is a lawmaker of the Uri Party and a German quintet arrived here today to participate in a concert to commemorate the 10th anniversary of the death of Yun I Sang. 
 They were greeted at the airport by U Sung Nam, vice-director of the Yun I Sang Music Institute.

articles.title: Visits
articles.content:
Visits
    Pyongyang, October 25 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the DPRK Foreign Ministry headed by Vice Foreign Minister Kung Sok Ung left here today to visit European countries. 
 The delegation was seen off at the airport by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kim Hyong Jun, Swedish Ambassador to Korea Mats Foyer and Polish Ambassador to Korea Roman Iwaszkiewicz.    
 Meanwhile, a delegation of the Workers' Party of Turkey headed by Osman Yildiz, member of the Central Committee of the WPT, and a delegation of the Ministry of Health of Angola headed by Director Evelize Fresta arrived here.
